"[60-norah] " Deuced [clever woman]1760-clever woman , [Mrs. Reginald]30-mrs. reginald routh . [I]97-digby 'll write about the pipe when [I]97-digby come in . "[97-digby] [He]856-he was with [Lady Joan]38-lady joan for about two hours , and it was quite dark when [he]856-he left [[her]38-lady joan house]793-her house . [They]858-they had reached that stage in [their]858-they intercourse when conversation is rather difficult , but companionship is a matter of course . [They]858-they did not discuss the arts now , nor the ethics of [Socialism]33-socialism , nor the position of [woman]1067-woman . None of these things seemed to matter half so much to [them]858-they as [his]856-he prospects of getting fresh pupils , or [her]38-lady joan choice of a dining - room paper . And sometimes [they]858-they did not speak at all , though [their]858-they silence was never an embarrassed one . This afternoon there had been more than usual to talk about , for [she]38-lady joan had resolved to give up [her]38-lady joan visions of philanthropy and was thinking of going abroad , and [he]856-he had been trying to dissuade [her]38-lady joan , purely in [his]856-he character of [adviser]860-adviser , without letting [her]38-lady joan see that [he]856-he hoped [she]38-lady joan would remain in [London]8-london . [He]856-he was beginning to realize how much [he]856-he liked coming to see [her]38-lady joan , and how great a relief it was to escape from [the people who had claims upon [him]856-he , and for whose [bath - room pipes]862-bath - room pipes [he]856-he was legally responsible]861-the people who had claims upon him , and for whose bath - room pipes he was legally responsible , to [some one who had no claim upon [him]856-he , and whose [bath - room pipes]862-bath - room pipes were in consequence so much pleasanter to superintend]863-some one who had no claim upon him , and whose bath - room pipes were in consequence so much pleasanter to superintend . And [he]856-he walked down [the doorsteps]865-the doorsteps slowly , with a feeling that [he]856-he had not persuaded [her]38-lady joan to remain , and that [he]856-he was [a fool]1247-a fool not to have used the only methods of persuasion that [he]856-he would like to have used , and that might have gained [his]856-he point . There was a weary vista before [him]856-he of endless letters to [the plumber]867-the plumber , of endless commonplace conversations with [[his]856-he wife]129-his wife , of endless unfulfilled ambitions , everything that chokes the energy of [the artistic enthusiast who has been married]869-the artistic enthusiast who has been married long enough to lose [his]856-he first illusions , and not long enough to learn to do without them . [He]856-he was in the mood to be exasperated by a triviality , and [he]856-he swore beneath [his]856-he breath when [a man with a beard]870-a man with a beard stumbled against [him]856-he in [the portico]871-the portico . " [Digby]97-digby ! "[872-the man with the beard] shouted [the man with the beard]872-the man with the beard , in a voice that made [the passers - by]873-the passers - by stop and look . [The musician]106-the musician recoiled , and stammered something . [He]856-he said afterwards that the fateful truth flashed upon [him]856-he in a second of time , but in reality [he]856-he stood there for some moments while the existence of [the man before [him]856-he]875-the man before him slowly worked its way to [his]856-he brain . And with the realization of [Jack]41-jack 's existence came the realization of something [he]856-he had been trying for six months to hide from [himself]856-he . [Jack]41-jack 's return from the dead meant — good heavens ! what did it not mean to [him]856-he now ? And to [Joan]38-lady joan also ? " [You]38-lady joan — [you]38-lady joan must not go into [her]38-lady joan suddenly like this ; it might kill [her]38-lady joan , the shock , do n't [you]38-lady joan know , "[856-he] [he]856-he found [himself]856-he saying , in a kind of dream , when the first hurried and incoherent words of greeting had passed between [them]876-them . [Joan]38-lady joan was all [he]856-he was thinking of just then , [Joan]38-lady joan and the last six months of uninterrupted friendship . Yet [Digby]97-digby was not [a bad man]877-a bad man , nor [a malicious one]878-a malicious one exactly ; but [his]856-he old affection for [[his]856-he brother]418-his brother , which had always depended more on habit than on natural affinity , had been rudely broken by [his]41-jack supposed death , and it was not easy to revive it again now , nor was it made easier by a concurrence of circumstances which seemed to demand that [he]856-he should rather have stayed away altogether . Why had [Jack]41-jack chosen this moment to come back ? A few years back [the musician]106-the musician would have found an occasion for moralizing in the strange conflict of feelings within [him]41-jack . " [I]856-he — [I]856-he feel quite queer [myself]856-he , "[856-he] [he]856-he said , making an effort to grasp [[his]856-he brother]418-his brother 's hand more warmly ; " why on earth did n't [you]41-jack let [us]1761-us know that [the wrong man]1762-the wrong man — that [the other man]1763-the other man was killed ? [You]41-jack always did imagine that [we]1761-us knew all about [you]41-jack without [your]41-jack troubling to write to [us]1761-us , [Jack]41-jack . Never was so surprised in [my]856-he life,—delighted , [I]856-he should say . But what does it all mean ? "[856-he] " [Eh]1764-eh , what ? Why , do n't [you]41-jack see , [I]856-he thought it was all bally rot to write and explain that [they]1765-they had cabled [my]856-he name instead of [Jack Rackstraw]41-jack 's , because [I]856-he meant to come over that next mail . And then , when [I]856-he got [another berth]1766-another berth offered [me]856-he with an elegant screw , [I]856-he reckoned [I]856-he 'd take it and go on being dead for a space , rather a scheme , do n't [you]41-jack twig ? And besides , [I]856-he thought if [I]856-he lay low till next fall [Joan]38-lady joan might find out [she]38-lady joan cared for [me]856-he a bit more than [she]38-lady joan calculated , eh ? Has n't it been hard work , though , just sitting tight and not hearing from [her]38-lady joan ! Now , fire [yourself]41-jack , [Digby]97-digby , and let [me]856-he freeze on to that bell . [The Squire]205-the squire sat making calculations in [[his]899-he study]903-his study , as [he]899-he did nearly every day of [his]899-he life . There was nothing in [his]899-he appearance to denote that anything unusual , least of all anything exceedingly pleasant , had occurred to [him]899-he . And yet , it was only that morning that [they]904-they had told [him]899-he [Jack]41-jack was alive and was coming [home]233-home the same evening . Perhaps it was that , like [Digby]97-digby , [he]899-he found it hard to revive an affection that had ceased to be part of [his]899-he life six months ago ; or , more likely still , [he]899-he felt in some vague way or another that [Jack]41-jack had come back to life on purpose to produce some unpaid debts for [[his]41-jack father]235-his father to settle . [Sir Marcus]40-sir marcus never dissimulated , and [he]40-sir marcus made no attempt to conceal the fact that [his]40-sir marcus joy in [[his]40-sir marcus son]230-his son 's resurrection did not wholly compensate for the trouble that was certain to be a consequence of it . So [he]899-he sat making calculations as usual , though [[his]899-he wife]129-his wife felt bound to go into hysterics in [the drawing - room]296-the drawing - room , and [the rest of [the family]911-the family]910-the rest of the family were trying to erect a shaky evergreen arch in [the garden]270-the garden , with " Welcome [home]233-home ! "[910-the rest of the family] nailed on it in evergreen letters . [They]910-the rest of the family were making a good deal of noise over it , too , and the calculations did not get on , in consequence . [They]910-the rest of the family related this time to rabbits , to the number imported yearly from abroad , and the inadequate number reared in [the home country]913-the home country itself , and [Sir Marcus]40-sir marcus was making [them]910-the rest of the family with the object of writing a letter to the county paper , suggesting rabbit culture as a lucrative employment for [the British villager]914-the british villager . According to [Sir Marcus]40-sir marcus , [the British villager]914-the british villager had an immense amount of time on [his]914-the british villager hands . Not that [his]914-the british villager interest in the duck culture was in any degree on the wane , but the county paper had refused to insert any more of [his]899-he letters about [the Murville]10-murville ducks and the enormous profits that [the Murville laborer]832-the murville laborer was said to realize from breeding [them]917-them ; and so [the Squire]205-the squire had been only too glad to take up the question of tame rabbits , which was being tentatively ventilated by [a neighboring Squire]919-a neighboring squire in [another village]920-another village . [Sir Marcus]40-sir marcus never did anything tentatively , however ; so [he]40-sir marcus began by talking rabbits at [every man [he]40-sir marcus met in [the village street]922-the village street]921-every man he met in the village street ; and as [every man [he]40-sir marcus met]923-every man he met , owing to [his]923-every man he met own former persuasions , was [a ducker]924-a ducker , that worthy generally received [his]923-every man he met recommendation of this new animal with something like distrust . [The duckers of [Murville]10-murville]925-the duckers of murville could not understand any article of commerce that did not lay eggs , and although [they]925-the duckers of murville obediently ate the few samples that [the Squire]205-the squire sent round to [them]925-the duckers of murville for [their]925-the duckers of murville Sunday dinners , yet [they]925-the duckers of murville did so with much condescension , and no little suspicion that [they]925-the duckers of murville were being coaxed into liking a new food that must be inferior because it was cheap . "[929-the biggest ducker in the village] [The handy man]218-the handy man shook [his]218-the handy man head dumbly , which was [his]218-the handy man usual form of reply , and the one that [[his]218-the handy man hearers]427-his hearers generally preferred ; and [Tom Clarke]95-tom clarke continued [his]218-the handy man ruminations for the benefit of any of [the members present who might be inclined to listen to [him]218-the handy man]935-the members present who might be inclined to listen to him . " [Rabbits]101-rabbits beats [me]95-tom clarke altogether , [I]95-tom clarke be bound to own . [They]101-rabbits bain't poultry , and [they]101-rabbits bain't [butcher]1800-butcher 's meat neither . So [you]1810-you see how [a man]290-a man be upset all along o ' them beasts , if [ye]1810-you can call a thing a beast what eats like string . "[95-tom clarke] [Mrs. Tom Clarke]95-tom clarke , in spite of the cookery lectures that had been given in [the Club]936-the club on Wednesday evenings , by [an expert from [London]8-london]937-an expert from london , who had evolved strange dishes from herring heads and mutton bones with the aid of a patent portable stove , still preferred to cook [[her]937-an expert from london husband]264-her husband 's food in [her]937-an expert from london own way , and this generally consisted in putting it into a saucepan from which the duck 's food had just been extracted,—a process which had the effect of making everything taste alike ; so it was certainly probable that [the Squire]205-the squire 's rabbit had not had a fair chance in [that cottage]940-that cottage , at all events . But in spite of the opposition [he]264-her husband was receiving from [[his]264-her husband most faithful adherents]941-his most faithful adherents , [Sir Marcus]40-sir marcus still sat patiently , and made [his]264-her husband calculations for [his]264-her husband new letter to the papers . [He]264-her husband had already written to [two or three members of Parliament]942-two or three members of parliament for statistics , and had received replies from [the House of Commons]943-the house of commons which [he]264-her husband folded on [his]264-her husband writing - table with the address uppermost , and in which [they]943-the house of commons mostly referred [him]264-her husband to [Whitaker]103-whitaker ; and [he]264-her husband had caused a slight disruption at the luncheon table , only that day , by wanting to know the good of the expensive education [he]264-her husband had given [[his]264-her husband children]221-his children if it turned [them]221-his children out ignorant of rabbits . [The children]1111-the children were wishing just then that [[their]1111-the children father]212-their father 's new hobby had not happened to possess [him]264-her husband in the Christmas holidays , and [Lady Raleigh]45-lady raleigh had taken the precaution of telling [[her]45-lady raleigh cook]947-her cook to jug the hare and make it as unlike a rabbit as possible , so that dinner might pass off more peaceably than luncheon had done . " [I]40-sir marcus must have [Joan]38-lady joan down ; [she]38-lady joan would sympathize , "[40-sir marcus] murmured [Sir Marcus]40-sir marcus , laying [his]40-sir marcus pen down , and reading the first sentences [he]40-sir marcus had written of [his]40-sir marcus letter . " [Splendid woman]1812-splendid woman , [Joan]38-lady joan , never laughs at [my]40-sir marcus little ideas , and takes such an interest in them . Shows what intelligence can do for [a girl]1773-a girl . [She]38-lady joan 'd have made [Jack]102-jack realize the responsibilities of existence , [she]38-lady joan would . [Devil]104-devil take [my]40-sir marcus head , why is it swimming so this afternoon ? "[40-sir marcus] The letter did not get on very fast , there was too much similarity between its sentiments and those [he]264-her husband had so often expressed before ; it looked rather as though [he]264-her husband were adapting an old letter by scratching out " duck "[264-her husband] and substituting " rabbit , "[264-her husband] for [he]264-her husband found [himself]264-her husband writing that the feathers and eggs alone of one rabbit more than repaid the cost of rearing it . " [Digby]97-digby used to come down and see [me]40-sir marcus oftener than [he]102-jack does now , "[40-sir marcus] said [Sir Marcus]40-sir marcus , laying down [his]40-sir marcus pen again and passing [his]40-sir marcus hand across [his]40-sir marcus brow . " [I]40-sir marcus do n't like [his]102-jack being away so long , and [the dear little boy]1814-the dear little boy too ; why do n't [they]1815-they come and see [me]40-sir marcus ? Got [a wife]1577-a wife ? Oh , to be sure , yes ; [my]40-sir marcus memory do n't seem so strong as it was , somehow : to be sure , [a wife]1577-a wife , yes . Nice little thing , very ; wonder if [she]1577-a wife would know how many [we]1818-we get yearly from [Holland]27-holland ? [My]40-sir marcus hand gets more tired than it used , though it would n't do to say so ; [people]1615-people are so ready to talk about [an old man]1820-an old man breaking up before [he]1820-an old man 's out of the sixties . Why , [I]40-sir marcus walked up from [the post - office]1166-the post - office in eight minutes and a half this morning ; [I]40-sir marcus can beat [the youngsters]1822-the youngsters now , eh ? [I]40-sir marcus wish [Joan]38-lady joan would come and catch hold of this accursed letter , it keeps drifting so far away . [I]40-sir marcus can walk with the best of [them]948-three people destined for murville manor , eh , [Joan]38-lady joan , [[my]40-sir marcus dear]1106-my dear ? "[40-sir marcus] There were [three people destined for [Murville Manor]3-murville manor]948-three people destined for murville manor in the 6.45 from [Euston]28-euston that evening . [Two of [them]948-three people destined for murville manor]949-two of them were in [separate third - class smoking carriages at the end of [the train]951-the train]950-separate third - class smoking carriages at the end of the train ; [the other]157-the other sat in [a first - class compartment]953-a first - class compartment . [The two brothers]956-the two brothers , singularly enough , each spent the greater part of the two hours ' journey in reading and re - reading a letter , which was written , in both cases , in a thick , rather illegible handwriting . [The musician]106-the musician , as [he]106-the musician took [his]106-the musician from the already opened envelope , gave a half - conscious look round [the carriage]1609-the carriage before [he]106-the musician read it . [It]959-it dated from the day before , and had no heading to it : — " [I]38-lady joan think on consideration that the new form of diversion [you]1827-you proposed to [me]38-lady joan the other night would not work so well as [we]956-the two brothers thought . So [I]38-lady joan am not going to entertain it any longer . [You]1827-you will probably blame [me]38-lady joan for [my]38-lady joan vacillation ; but then , [you]1827-you should not have established a precedent for vacillation in the ' Relton Arms , ' four years ago . After all , there is nothing left but the book ; and [I]38-lady joan am going to be away , and alone , until [I]38-lady joan have written it . Do n't be alarmed . [I]38-lady joan am not going to soak it with [my]38-lady joan own experiences . "[38-lady joan] [Joan]38-lady joan . " [[His]106-the musician younger brother]1828-his younger brother , in [the other carriage]1829-the other carriage , did not look at [any one]1152-any one when [he]1828-his younger brother took [his]1828-his younger brother letter from [his]1828-his younger brother breast - pocket and unfolded it . It was very limp , and looked as though it had been unfolded many times before . It was dated two days earlier : — "[38-lady joan] [[My]0-i dear]1106-my dear [Boy,—I]105-boy,—i am [a cad]961-a cad , and [I]0-i hate [myself]0-i for what [I]0-i have done to [you]1106-my dear . "[0-i] [The station for [Murville village]967-murville village]966-the station for murville village was two miles away from [the Manor House]968-the manor house , or from any human habitation of importance ; and as [the train]951-the train slowly steamed away from [it]966-the station for murville village to - night , [the three passengers whom [it]951-the train had brought from [town]183-town , unknown to [each other]693-each other]970-the three passengers whom it had brought from town , unknown to each other , were [the only three whom [it]951-the train had deposited on [the platform]974-the platform]973-the only three whom it had deposited on the platform . " Why are [you]1019-he here to - night ? "[60-norah] [she]60-norah asked [him]1019-he , as [he]1019-he held [her]60-norah to [him]1019-he more closely than usual . " So [Joan]38-lady joan went away to - day , did [she]38-lady joan ? "[60-norah] [she]60-norah added . " [Joan]38-lady joan ? Did [she]38-lady joan write to [you]60-norah ? "[1019-he] [he]1019-he said , beginning to feel vaguely alarmed . [She]60-norah had disengaged [herself]60-norah from [his]1019-he arms , and was walking away to the window . " Oh , nothing . Only it is a pity [you]1019-he leave [your]1019-he coats about . [I]60-norah should never have known if [you]1019-he had not been so careless . At least , [I]60-norah fancy [I]60-norah have known all the winter , "[60-norah] [she]60-norah added dreamily , as if to [herself]60-norah . " Known what ? "[1019-he] [he]1019-he asked in a voice [he]1019-he did not seem to recognize . But [he]1019-he knew ; and [he]1019-he felt rather worse than when [he]1019-he had stood in [the porch]333-the porch that afternoon , watching [Joan]38-lady joan over [the fields]1022-the fields . "[60-norah] " Well ? [I]1019-he do n't want [you]60-norah to touch [me]1019-he , if [you]60-norah would rather not , "[1019-he] [he]1019-he said roughly , and did not look at [her]60-norah . " [I]60-norah want to tell [you]1019-he , "[60-norah] [she]60-norah went on softly . " [I]60-norah found [Joan]38-lady joan 's letter , and [I]60-norah read it as a matter of course ; [I]60-norah thought it was about — oh , never mind what . That was the day [you]1019-he went down to [Murville]10-murville ; and [I]60-norah could not speak to [you]1019-he then . It has been so dreadful waiting for [you]1019-he to come back , [Digby]32-digby . Are [you]1019-he not going to look at [me]60-norah , now [you]1019-he have come ? "[60-norah] [He]1019-he turned round bewildered , and saw [her]60-norah eyes full of tears . " [Good God]51-god , [Norah]60-norah , do [you]1019-he mean [you]1019-he can know that , and — ? "[1019-he] " Yes , [dear]1085-dear . [I]60-norah think [I]60-norah know more than [you]1085-dear . [I]60-norah think [I]60-norah know how [you]1085-dear have been feeling lately , and all the winter . But [I]60-norah did not know it was as bad as this , and when [I]60-norah read that letter — do [you]1085-dear know how [I]60-norah felt ? [I]60-norah think [I]60-norah must tell [you]1085-dear , [Digby]32-digby ; [I]60-norah have had something to bear too , [you]1085-dear know . [I]60-norah felt first that something terrible had come between [you]1085-dear and [me]60-norah , something that wanted pushing away with all [my]60-norah might ; and [I]60-norah could n't do it alone , [Digby]32-digby , and [you]1085-dear — [you]1085-dear were not there to help [me]60-norah . And then — [I]60-norah only felt sorry for [you]1085-dear . [I]60-norah have just longed for [you]1085-dear to come back that [I]60-norah might put [my]60-norah arms round [you]1085-dear and comfort [you]1085-dear , and tell [you]1085-dear that [I]60-norah knew . [Digby]32-digby , do n't turn away like that . "[60-norah] " But — it is inconceivable — do [you]32-digby know what [you]32-digby are saying ? Do [you]32-digby know that if that letter had not been written , [I]1032-you should have — ? "[1032-you] [He]1032-you paused , for [he]1032-you could not bring [himself]1032-you to finish the sentence . But [she]1033-she sprang away from [him]1032-you suddenly , and stood in front of [him]1032-you in the middle of [the room]135-the room , with [her]1033-she hands clasped at the back of [her]1033-she head , and a blaze of triumph in [her]1033-she eyes . " No , no , not that ! "[1033-she] [she]1033-she cried ; " never that ! [I]1033-she knew it could not be . If [I]1033-she had thought [you]1032-you capable of that , should [I]1033-she be speaking to [you]1032-you now like this ? Do [you]1032-you think [women]1228-women are [such fools]1875-such fools then ? [I]1033-she know , [she]1033-she knew — that [you]1032-you were not capable of it , that [you]1032-you never meant it , that it was one of [your]1032-you queer impulses that make [me]1033-she love [you]1032-you so madly , and that [she]1033-she can never forgive in [you]1032-you . That is why [she]1033-she wrote [you]1032-you that letter . That is why [you]1032-you are mine now , [mine]1033-she , [mine]1033-she , [mine]1033-she ! "[1033-she] [The musician]106-the musician fell in love more thoroughly that afternoon than [he]106-the musician had ever fallen in love before . [He]106-the musician fell in love with [[his]106-the musician own wife]1036-his own wife . " [We]1037-they must have [Joan]38-lady joan up to stay with [us]1037-they ; [she]38-lady joan could write nicely at the table in [the dining - room]1150-the dining - room , could n't [she]38-lady joan ? "[60-norah] said [Norah]60-norah , when [they]1037-they began to talk rationally again . [They]1037-they felt wonderfully fond of [Joan]38-lady joan this evening . " Oh , do [you]1036-his own wife think so ? [I]106-the musician fancy [she]38-lady joan 'll be all right down at [Relton]38-lady joan for the present , "[106-the musician] [he]106-the musician answered . [He]106-the musician was feeling that [he]106-the musician could do with [[his]106-the musician wife]129-his wife for a good long time now . " It 's just as [you]106-the musician like , [dear]1085-dear . And do [you]106-the musician know , [baby]1632-baby is so wonderfully good now [she]1632-baby has nearly all [her]1632-baby teeth , that [I]129-his wife believe [you]106-the musician would find [the study]1879-the study quiet enough to write music in . It has been very uncomfortable for [you]106-the musician lately , has n't it ? "[129-his wife] said [she]129-his wife . " Oh , it 's been all right . And [I]106-the musician do n't think [I]106-the musician want to write music much . [I]106-the musician say , do [you]129-his wife think [baby]1632-baby will take to [me]106-the musician now ? "[106-the musician] said [he]106-the musician . Then [she]129-his wife laughed , and [he]106-the musician demanded the reason of [her]129-his wife merriment . " [I]129-his wife was thinking how [Joan]38-lady joan once said that [I]129-his wife should never be able to understand [your]106-the musician nature , and that [you]106-the musician would be wounding [me]129-his wife half - a - dozen times a day , "[129-his wife] [she]129-his wife explained , and laughed again . " How absurd of [her]38-lady joan , "[106-the musician] [he]106-the musician cried , and roared with laughter [himself]106-the musician ; " but then [you]129-his wife know , [childie]1477-childie , [Joan]38-lady joan has always been possessed with the idea that [we]1039-we were not born for [each other]693-each other . "[106-the musician] " Could anything be more ridiculous ? "[60-norah] said [Norah]60-norah ; and [they]1039-we broke into a fresh peal of laughter , without any apparent reason for it . A distant wail from [the nursery]1730-the nursery summoned [her]129-his wife presently , and [Digby]32-digby was left alone in [the dining - room]1150-the dining - room . [He]106-the musician smoked two cigarettes in silence , with a complacent smile , and [he]106-the musician delivered [himself]106-the musician of [his]106-the musician favorite exclamation as [he]106-the musician rolled up a third . " Good heavens ! "[106-the musician] [he]106-the musician said out loud ; " if it were not for habit what chance would there be for marriage ?
